title: How does one play XIn Zhao these days?
body:
I like playing XIn Zhao, but recently, and especially after the changes to sated/guinsoo (which was broken af), he just feels.... bad.

i don't know if he is just in a really rough spot, but for a champion who is almost entirely AA reliant, with 1 mobility skill and a displacement on his ult... he seems like he can't do nearly as much as his counterparts in the jungle. most of his strength comes from super heavily committing to fights and sustaining and being an overall nuisance... but he doesn't really fill any role that other champions don't fill better. He feels underwhelming, and yes, while people can have success with him, he has low cc and can't function as a tanky/frontline champ until he gets at least his 3rd or 4th item...

He can't burst people, he can't stick unless he buys an item to do so({{item:3022}} yuck) or if he runs ghost.... 

I just feel like he is in the really weird spot where he is a bruiser/diver... but isn't really good at either until late game.... even Vi is in a much better spot than he is...

I have found a few things that have worked for me, but I feel like in doing so i am just patching up his pretty obvious flaws and trying to find ways to work around them.... 

anyone else kinda feel this way about XIn? Are there even any Xin Zhao players anymore? Has anyone found a good build path/runes/masteries that allow him to function a bit better?

I remember a couple years ago i would build the warriors item for the strong early ganks, then into full tank for late game. I only did one game with the devourer/rageblade combo when it was a thing, and it was hilariously strong; the enemy WW built the same thing and would be annihilated in a duel with me. I feel like the temptation to go heavy damage is strong, since so many damage items work well on him, but it's best to go mostly tanky based on how his kit works. I'm honestly interested to see what the responses here are, myself.

Also, I'm gonna share the best way I use to win more games using this Xin Zhao build in particular. 

Every time you successfully gank, type in all chat: "Let It Goooo! Let It Goooo!"

They definitely won't get it at first, but once you start getting the frozen items, you can bet they'll get tilted to oblivion. Try it, it definitely works.

I get both FH and IBG because they provide a 155 armor and 40% CDR between the two of them. Also, don't underestimate 900 extra mana. Xin Zhao heals enough even without items to always be at full health outside of combat, but he has no means to gain more mana, and running out of mana, not health, is usually the main cause of me recalling. The extra mana allows me to literally never go have to go home except to buy items. 

Notice that I buy two straight up Health Items (Cinderhulk and FM) first. Since these two provide 1207.5 extra health on their own, resistances become so much more efficient to stack.

In team fights, AoE is King. IBG is there for the AoE Physical Damage and AoE Slow, Cinderhulk is there for the AoE Magic Damage, and Frozen Heart is there for the AoE Attack Speed Debuff. Frozen Mallet is just there to make sure no stragglers get any bright ideas to run away.
Xin Zhao is GREAT in low elo.
